intro: Draba rupestris var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate rockcress, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is often found in open, sunny environments at high elevations.
